intro: Valerianella kulabensis, commonly known as the Kulab valerian, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It has a compact growth habit with finely divided leaves and is often found in high-altitude meadows. Valerianella kulabensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to harsh climates and potential medicinal properties.
